tp:docstring.p: The CallManager interface is used to manage call and conference related actions.

Since daemon supports multiple incoming/outgoing calls, any actions involving a specific call must address the method by the means of a unique callID. Daemon will generate a unique callID for outgoing and incoming calls.
This is the main method in order to place a new call. The call is registered with the daemon using this method.

arg.name: accountID
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the account with which you want to make a call. If the call is to be placed without any account by means of a SIP URI (i.e. sip:num@server), the "IP2IP_PROFILE" is passed as the accountID. For more details on accounts see the configuration manager interface.

arg.name: to
arg.tp:docstring: If bound to a VoIP account, then the argument is the phone number. In case of calls involving "IP2IP_PROFILE", a complete SIP URI must be specified.

method.name: refuse

signal.name: SmartInfo
signal.tp:docstring: Once enabled using the startSmartInfo method, this signal is emitted every refreshTimeMS

method.name: accept
method.tp:docstring: Answer an incoming call. Automatically puts the current call on HOLD.

method.name: acceptWithMedia
method.tp:docstring: Answer an incoming call with the list of media. This version to control attributes for each media (accepted, muted, ...)

method.name: answerMediaChangeRequest
method.tp:docstring: Answer to a media update request.

arg.name: mediaList
arg.tp:docstring: The list of media. Shoudld be of the same size as the media list in the media update request. An empty media list means that the media update request was refused.

method.name: hangUpConference
method.tp:docstring: Hangup a conference, and every call participating to the conference.

method.name: hold
method.tp:docstring: Place a call on hold.

method.name: unhold
method.tp:docstring: Take a call off hold, and place this call in state CURRENT.

arg.name: mediaType
arg.tp:docstring: The type of media (AUDIO or VIDEO)

arg.name: mute
arg.tp:docstring: True to mute audio capture, false to unmute.

arg.name: res
arg.tp:docstring: True if mute succeed. False otherwise

method.name: transfer
method.tp:docstring: Transfer a call to the given phone number.

arg.name: to

method.name: attendedTransfer
method.tp:docstring: Perform an attended transfer on two calls.

arg.name: transferID
arg.tp:docstring: The callID of the call to be transferred.

arg.name: targetID

method.name: playDTMF
method.tp:docstring: Dual-Tone multi-frequency. Tell the core to play dialtones. A SIP INFO message is sent to notify the server.

method.name: startTone
method.tp:docstring: Start audio stream and play tone.

tp:docstring.p: Change displayed layout for a conference. We currently support 3 layouts: 0. (default) = grid view 1. One big with small previews 2. One participant

Depending the layout of the conference, someone can be shown bigger than the others. This methods is here to set which call is shown. Note if the active participant leave while shown, the layout will change to the default one (grid view).

tp:docstring.p: As the core can handle multiple calls and conferences, it may happen that the client's user leaves a conference to answer an incoming call or to start new calls. This method is used to reintroduce client's user into the conference.
Its put the current call on HOLD or detaches client's user from the another conference.

method.name: detachLocalParticipant

method.name: detachParticipant
method.tp:docstring: Detach the given call from the conference. If only one participant is left, the conference is deleted and the signal conferenceRemoved is emitted.

signal.name: incomingMessage
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that new messages have been received. The key is the mime type and the value the mime payload.

tp:docstring.p: Notify of a change in a call state.
The client must subscribe to this signal.

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring:
The acceptable states are:
INCOMING: Initial state of incoming calls
CONNECTING: Peer found, contacting him
RINGING: Initial state of received outgoing call
CURRENT: The normal active state of an answered call
HUNGUP: Notify that the call has been hungup by peer
BUSY: Notify that we terminated an incoming call after timeout
PEER_BUSY: Notify that peer replied BUSY to this call
FAILURE: Error when processing a call
HOLD
UNHOLD

arg.name: code
arg.tp:docstring: The optional account-type specific message code. 0 if not set.

signal.name: conferenceChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify of a change in the conferences state

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring:
The acceptable states are:
ACTIVE_ATTACHED: user is participating to this conference
ACTIVE_DETACHED: This situation can occur if a call is received while user is participating to a conference. In this case, one can leave the conference by answering the call. Other participants may continue conferencing normally.
HOLD: Each call in this conference is on state HOLD

method.name: getDisplayNames

arg.name: list

arg.name: list
arg.tp:docstring: The list of the call IDs.

signal.name: conferenceCreated
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a new conference is created. Client is responsible for storing the confID and call getParticipantList to update the display.

signal.name: conferenceRemoved
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a new conference is remove. Client should have kept a list of current participant in order to display modification.

method.name: unholdConference
